title: Use cell references effectively in formulas to create dynamic calculations
learning_objectives: Use cell references effectively in formulas to create dynamic calculations

vocabulary.definition: The address of a cell in a formula, combining column letter and row number (e.g., B5)
A cell reference that changes when copied to another cell (e.g., A1 becomes A2 when copied down)
A cell reference that stays fixed when copied, marked with dollar signs (e.g., $A$1)
A cell reference with one fixed component, like $A1 (fixed column) or A$1 (fixed row)
A formula that automatically updates when the source data changes
The process of checking which cells a formula references and ensuring correctness
